title: Short call
body: I called to book an appointment, so had a telephone consultation. I had 2issues but reception said i can discuss both during the phone call. When the doctor called, she said only one problem at a time. The call lasted 3mins,feels like my issue is unimportant. Not feeling the tax am paying. Disappointing.

title: Fantastic Service
body: I don't understand the bad reviews I've read. I have been with the Devonshire Practice since 1999, and since the merge with the Southsea things have only improved. The reception staff and nurses are friendly and helpful. Even during this last 12 months, throughout COVID they have done their best to help... Many thanks.

title: They don't pick up the phone
body: I called at 4.30pm and gave up after waiting, being on hold for an hour. They don't answer the phones. This is a regular occurrence. The last thing you want to do when ill is waiting on the phone for as long as this.

title: Unacceptable booking Times
body: I had to wait 25mins on the phone in the queue to book an appointment today. It's beyond me why booking a GP appointment can take so long with this practice. It is a common occurrence with this practice and even though there are multiple negative reviews about it nothing seems to change. Yes there is the option of Ask NHS, however this is a very hard task for some elderly patients who are not very computer literate. To make matters worse, if so many patients are indeed able to book via AskNHS, then it makes waiting 25mins all the more worse! its a total disgrace, it actually makes one feel so much more frustrated while on hold that you end up coming off the call extremely angry and upset.

title: Excellent GP Surgery
body: I have been a patient at various GP surgeries and practices over the years on account of a number of home moves since university and would say that out of all of them, Berwick Surgery have consistently provided the highest and most efficient level of service and standard of care, certainly in my experience, to date.

title: Great organisation for Covid vaccination
body:
Staff managed long queue very well, keeping us informed about the process and progress at every stage. 
I was put at ease at vaccination time, as I am not too good with injections.

title: smear
body: Painless smear reassuring Nurse practitioner making me feel at ease & chatting away quick & easy smear

title: Absolute shambles
body: Clap! I was finally referred for an MSK appointment after 3 months of chronic pain and medication by my GP, called MSK triage on the 26th of April, and got an appointment(phone) for next week. After my appointment had passed I called the number and apparently they have not updated my phone number on their records and told me they have the next available appointment in 23 days time. The system and processes you have in place are an absolute joke and I just needed to make anyone aware maybe someone someday will have the common sense and decency to change something to the better instead of thinking only about politics and how to tax extort residents.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust
Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Superb service
body:
Visited urology/ diagnostic centre.Saw consultant and had scan, with diagnosis given at the same appointment. Consultant, radiographer, nurses and reception all pleasant and helpful. 
An excellent service avoiding the need for an anxious wait for results. 
Thank you.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good Experience
body:
Visited the Parklands Suite, Lyme Drive, Stoke-on-Trent today for Glaucoma Monitoring. The friendly receptionist welcomed me and took my temperature.
The waiting area is very clean and nicely decorated.
The lady who carried out the tests was very kind, friendly and reassuring. She explained everything clearly and didn`t rush me at all.
Overall a very pleasant experience.

title: When you eventually get to talk to a GP it’s…
body:
So my experience had been very bad, taking so long to actually talk to a Dr, but once I did I have to say the service was excellent, a full explanation, treatment options and caring. 
Just how much longer will it be before we are able to book appointments either in person or phone consultations ?

title: Great service, always time to listen
body: I have been with this GP surgery for a number of years. My doctor always has time to sit and listen to my issues. A+

title: Impossible to Register as New Patient
body: I've been to the Fordbridge Medical Centre 4 times to register myself as a new patient in the NHS and local GP. But always the receptionist asks me to come back next week because or somebody is not there, or the system isn't working at the moment, or nobody finds my online registration. And I am still without registration on NHS and GP. I suggest the Fordbridge Medical Centre's Head provide more training for this team.

title: Practice during covid
body:
The online appointments are good however having to set your alarm for 3am in order to secure an appointment is stressful.I am pleased the vaccination programme and figures re new cases and deaths of covid are reducing and I look forward to being able to see a doctor easily and safely for both patients and doctors.
The doctor I saw recently was very caring and made me feel both welcome and valued.
I do need to see the doctor regarding other ailments but I have tried to prioritize which seem to be most important.Lets hope I have got it right.The drop down list only allows one problem at a time and a 5minute telephone conversation is soon over.In all honesty I do feel that asking to see a doctor these days is wrong and I don't think that is way I should feel.The reality is I am getting older and unfortunately my visits are likely to increase through no fault of my own

title: Always been good to me
body: On the few occasions I've needed medical attention the staff and doctors at Thorndike have been really good. The online appointment booking system wouldn't let me actually make an appointment as there were no slots left - but apart from that, no complaints from me.

title: Wonderful care at the Endoscopy unit
body: I’d like to thank the Endoscopy unit for their absolutely wonderful care from start till finish. The staff were very friendly, caring and professional. I had both gastroscopy and colonoscopy for the first time in my life and due to my friends and family living far away, I opted for no sedation to be able to go home on my own. My special thanks go to the nurse who was there for the procedures and supported me and made me feel more comfortable and less lonely. You are all doing wonderful work - thank you!

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: I wish it was a great practice
body: For the last 3 weeks I have been trying to get a doctors app. Start ringing  at 8-30 am & the phone goes straight to call back , so I try all the time call back, after 10 mins the phone is put on to ring constantly until a message comes up . I am not dying so to call 111 is really not fair, but I do have a problem in which to have an answer from the doctor would be very comforting.

title: Good service
body: I've been using this surgery since 2004 and i can honestly say that the level of care compassion and the attention paid to ailments is quite outstanding. I recently had a cyst that needed a scan it was promptly referred to basildon hospital for a scan within 3 weeks. I was really impressed with the speed at which I got referred putting my mind at rest.

title: Thank you
body: My first time posting a review and may I say I am sorry to read the negative comments. I both called and visited the surgery this week not the first time during COVID restrictions and I have to say It really is a safe environment. I understand the pressures you are all under but I would like to thank you all for your continued hard work. I waited a while on the phone to get through ( Well done on the call waiting system) I got through and was helped by a very polite receptionist. She wasn't able to deal with one of my two queries straight away stating, "she would call me back when she got the answer I was looking for from her Team leader" True to her word she called me back before the end of the day. I feel the answer message is informative and helps them to deal with the calls they deal with at 8am. I was also able to pre-book an appointment for next week as it was a non urgent matter. Again a huge Thank you to all of you and stay safe and positive.

title: Exemplary care and kindness
body:
I can honestly say that the RBH looked after my Mum amazingly; both her surgical team and then ICU. So thoughtful, kind and empathetic. 
They are all part of such an amazing, hardworking team, and despite the outcome, she (and I) genuinely couldn't have received better care. 
Every single person I've had contact with in A&E, Surgical Assessment Unit and ICU, and the Bereavement office has, in my opinion, been outstanding in carrying out their job. 
Every one of them has reminded me just how lucky and privileged we are to have our NHS.

title: Thank you
body: Amazing staff, had my Covid jab today, keep doing what you are doing Loddon vale your real patients are so great full.

title: Great practice
body: I had a cataract removed at Coventry SpaMedica, I was very nervous but I was quickly put at ease,the staff were professional and friendly. Many thanks.

title: Very rude staff members
body:
I have not been to my gp surgery in over a year. today I went to collect my blood form and was very shocked to witness the level of rudeness and attitude towards another patient who was sent to the wrong surgery by a receptionist and the manager. Their behaviour was totally uncalled for and escalated the situation when it really did not need to happen. I’m tired of receptionists thinking they can speak to patients with such disrespect and not expect a reaction in return, if she had simply explained to the gentleman in a respectful way that his doctor had mistakenly sent him to the wrong surgery then what I witnessed today would not of have happened. 

Having a little decency and respect for people really goes a long way and doesn’t cost a thing.

title: Dreadful communication
body: Have made mistakes in my meds and failed to tell me I needed a review of my tramadol . Trying to sort this is intensely frustrating phoning the surgery makes you lose the will to live. In the reviews it says the average wait to get through is 2-3 mins . Find that hard to believe as only once have I got response that quickly. Usually takes around ten minutes at least, half an hour if you are calling for an appointment first thing, by which time you get the last available appointment if you are lucky. If you have a query about your meds or treatment the operator t Akes a message and someone might get back to you if you are lucky. You never can talk to anyone apart from the operators who are just message takers. It's nigh on impossible to deal with the same doctor each time which is really important if you have a number of complex medical conditions. You give feedback to the operators and they get really snooty and imply you should count yourself lucky they even answer the phone. This was a problem well before covid but they keep using that as an excuse for poor service and communication. They have no concept of patient centred care it's run like a factory, and we are just numbers to be processed.

title: Good but could be so much better
body:
Arrived at 0915 for 0930 appointment in General Outpatients. Board was already showing 30-45 minute delay. At 1030 a staff member came out and changed this to 60-90 minute delay. No word of explanation. Completely blanked everyone waiting. Finally got in at 1115. How can they run so late so early in the day?
This is typical of all appointments. Never get to be seen on time. 1.45 hours is usually how long we have to wait.
Care is good and compassionate. But please sort out the waiting times!

title: Poor service
body:
Poor service.. My  2 weeks son was ill and I went there because I was told I would get medicine for his illness but wasn’t told which pharmacy to pick it up. Called several times but didn’t get through so I went there. Started explaining to the receptionist -she was very dismissive and told me to fill out a form and drop it in the box and call via telephone to find out which pharmacy to go to.I cried because I was desperately worried about my son plus she was so rude.
Now my son needs to get his 8 weeks vaccination. I have been calling and asking for an appointment every week since 5 weeks and I still have nothing. Had to try to explain to the receptionist that his immunity is declining with time so he needs it.
I accept this is coronavirus time but this is absolutely terrible service.

title: Answering the phonr
body: Put in a queue get right down to you are next and then call cannot be completed message after a lengthy wait.Has caused me great stress,happened at least 4 times .now.Also don't they realise many people work shifts and cannot phone at 8am to be faced with an hour wait.I would love to speak to the practice manager about this debacle,the doctors are fine and helpful.Maybe needs a word with our local MP and give him an example of what is going on with this phone lark!

title: Disappointed
body: The doctors here are great if you can get to them! Ridiculous waiting  on the phone to get through to the reception and when you finally do,receptionist says that all GPS are fully booked, call back again tomorrow at 8 am .if you're lucky you get an advanced practitioner who is rushed and stressed. She told me she had not enough time to listen to all my  problems, that I had to call in again for that.

author: saturnrx58
title: Went for a BV diagnosis
body: I went for an appointment which I got a few days after my phone call, 5 star service by the way, the ladies I spoke to on the phone were incredibly helpful and speedy - I phoned up to see if I could push my appointment back an hour, originally I couldn't but less than 3 minutes later I had a call back saying it had been arranged. I turned up and was welcomed with nothing but patience and understanding. My actual meeting was made very comfortable, I was offered a chaperone, my nurse was very empathetic and helpful in a very maternal way. I didnt feel judged at all I felt very comforted.

title: The worst practice
body: No one answer the phone . Stuff is extremely unhelpful and very very rude to the patients.  I don't know why they are here. Phone is ringing and ringing and they laugh and talk to each other totally ignoring the phone .

author: Jogrif
title: My dads end of life journey
body: My dad was admitted to the GLU ward a week or so ago, the nurses have been brilliant. Kind caring and compassionate. Could not ask for anything more.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: ElaineM12
title: Maternity Unit - Extremely positive experience
body:
I had the most amazing experience delivering my second child at the RAH midwife unit. I came into the unit in labour and was seen immediately, the bank staff Fiona was so welcoming and informative and made me feel very relaxed and comfortable.  
Fiona finished her shift 1.5 hours later and Caroline took over my care, Caroline’s approach was so warm and caring, she talked me through all my options of pain relief and next steps based on how far into labour I was. Caroline also made me feel like the decision was mine at each step of the way which helped me feel more in control. (I needed this as my first labour was the opposite due to a last minute induction).  
Once in my birthing room Caroline and Lynn both managed my late stages of labour within the birthing pool and they were superb at keeping me focused, positive and on track. Caroline and Lynn had a great tag team approach that made me feel that I was in really good hands. They made me laugh and lifted my spirits when labour was getting tough, I felt like I was being really well looked after the whole time. They also made my husband feel very relaxed and a real part of the delivery which he was very grateful for.  
The whole experience was unbelievably positive and my little boy was delivered in a very calm and relaxed environment.  
Caroline and Lynn make a great team and my experience could not have been any better, they are an absolute credit to their profession.  
Thank you so much ladies, an amazing experience I will remember positively forever. Thank you for being so good at what you do and giving mummy’s like me a chance to experience labour in such a positive way.

author: Cardiff Woman
title: Addiction and depression
body:
I was prescribed a cocktail of benzodiazepines which miraculously made all my problems go away. I didn’t realise at the time that the prescription had started a whole new set of problems, more insidious than my original anxiety and depression. When the prescription stopped it was so easy to buy them illicitly that I didn’t even consider how dangerous it might be until it was too late.  
I made terrible decisions which made my life worse, not better. When it all caught up with me my GP surgery told me about Taith. With regular help from Richard - who is a kind, understanding and knowledgable person - I tapered my diazepam use and made plans again.  
It’s not easy and without the help from this service it would have been even worse. I’m so grateful for this service and for Richard’s advice in particular. It was good to have someone who didn’t know me personally to champion each tiny step I made.  
Now I’ve gotten rid of the diazepam things are painful but I wouldn’t have a chance of being better if I was on them in the way I was (there’s an important distinction here as I don’t think anyone who needs them and uses them as prescribed should feel bad about it - it’s the fact I wasn’t prescribed them and was abusing them which makes this a problem).  
Thank you Richard! This was a big thing I had to change before I could start to work on the underlying problems.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Mindymoo
title: Road Accident Glencoe
body:
I am writing on behalf of my partner and I to thank the wonderful staff (Glencoe and Fort William ambulance service) who took care of us in Glencoe following a road accident at the end of April 2021.  
I would personally like to thank the paramedic Keith from Glencoe Ambulance Service who was so busy with the all those who were involved in the accident yet, still provided excellent and thorough care at all times to both my partner and I. I felt so at ease knowing I was in great care and Keith provided so much reassurance and comfort to what was one of the worst experiences I’ve ever endured.  
I am so grateful for how quick the Glencoe paramedics arrived and dealt with the situation at hand and I will always be thankful for your care and compassion.  
I would also like to thank the Fort William Ambulance service who took care of us from Glencoe to the Belford hospital.  
I would like to thank Andy and his team (I’m sorry I didn’t catch your names!) who provided excellent care to both my partner and I. You all made a horrible experience more bearable with compassion and thorough care. You also made a horrible journey, as smooth as possible considering the circumstances.  
I can’t thank you all enough for everything you all done for us, we will be forever grateful.  
A massive thanks,  
(From Glasgow, involved in head on collusion at Glencoe)

author: Squall
title: COVID-19 Astrazeneca vaccine (1st dose)
body: I experienced mild upper arm pain during the evening of Tuesday 27th April 2021 (after the vaccine) and the next day also.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Best GP Practice
body:
A big thank you to The Knares Surgery. From booking an appointment with the receptionist, who was very helpful and accommodating; to the doctor calling and listening to me and then arranged an immediate hospital appointment was impressive. What touched me was, the doctor asked me to notify the Surgery when I arrived at the hospital. I got a text back saying they were pleased I got there safely. This was during the first Covid lockdown. 
The personal touch from the Surgery staff, from the doctors to the nurses and the reception staff is commendable. 👌 Thank you.

author: requirementyf35
title: Coil replacement
body:
Dr Kundu and Susan were both excellent.  
Both were very reassuring. The procedure was over really quickly and I felt minimal pain.  
They were very friendly and kind.  
My only complaint would be that my initial staff member was very difficult to get hold of. I initially had an appointment with them but the strings of my coils were missing so I had to go for a scan before seeing Dr Kundu. I called and text them over the space of around a month and they never got back to me.

author: Myra59
title: Broken Ankle
body:
Went to the Day Surgery Wishaw Hospital and was first one in and last to leave.  
Was treated first class during my surgery with quality care next to none. The ward was so relaxed where staff seemed happy going about there duties and nothing seemed to be a problem. This created a great atmosphere in the ward which helped me relax and overcome my anxiety. Well Done Everyone.

author: Hughwal
title: Colonoscopy went very smoothly
body: I was extremely pleased with all the attention, both before, during and after this procedure from the Consultant/Endoscopist, Mr John and the two Staff Nurses, Vivian and Jennifer. In the first instance, I had gone to the wrong hospital, and, phoning the Victoria in a panic, was immediately reassured that I could still come along and would be seen. The whole procedure went very smoothly and was not as daunting as anticipated. I was treated with great kindness and professionalism throughout. Afterwards, in recovery, I was given a welcome mug of tea and toast, and escorted to my son's car to ensure I got away safely.

author: Salmamo6000
title: Especially thankful
body:
I been with service coming up to 3 years now. They have been fantastic providing information, resources and amazing recovery workers. This place is completely un judgemental safe place to share your story and experiences and hear from others.  
I'm especially thankful for my recovery worker she changed my life. Thank you Danielle

title: Great practice
body: Thank you to the very organised team for the covid 19 vaccination, early Saturday morning and extremely friendly

author: Bregagh
title: You comforted and supported us as a family
body:
Critical & Acute Care  
I write on behalf of my entire family.  
The commitment, dedication and tireless care of the entire staff in Surgical 2 has been overwhelming.  
Led by Sister Dyson we, as a family, want to thank the staff in Surgical 2 for their professionalism, communication, time and kindness shown. Simply taking time out of their incredibly busy days to come to the phone and update us has comforted and reassured us in these incredibly challenging times. To all the disciplines involved who have propelled the progress of our Daddy, working alongside the nursing staff who have been incredible. To all of you we applaud you and want you to know how much we appreciate everything you do. You took time to get to know our Daddy, delivering messages and enquiring about his likes and dislikes, facilitating phone calls and talking through photos. You listened to and answered our questions. You addressed all of Daddy’s medical needs expertly and urgently - from the start we shared a common goal. From each individual who sat with Daddy, ward clerk, to the student Doctors, the nurses, Sister, Registrar, Consultant, the involvement of all disciplines: SaLT; Physiotherapy and Radiology, we acknowledge your efforts and expertise.  
You comforted and supported us as a family. We are beyond grateful for the care you have given our Daddy.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

title: Room 2 covid jab
body:
Received covid jab in room 2- put me at ease for somebody nervous of needles. I didn’t know if had been given. Nicknamed needle ninja, very apt. 🪡 🥷 
Ladies you were awesome. Thank you 🙏🏻

author: camelopardaliswg36
title: Oral surgery day tooth extraction experience
body: My daughter was a day case to have 3 teeth removed under general anaesthetic. This was her first time in hospital and it was a challenging time as she suffers from anxiety, panic and is needle phobic. I could not of asked for more brilliant care from the entire team - Debbie (Deputy Ward sister), Sam (Anaesthetist), Vincent (Surgeon), Lesley and Anthony (Recovery) plus two other theatre staff (sorry for not catching your names). My daughter became distraught prior to being anaesthetised and the care and compassion shown by the team was first class. I cannot thank you enough.

title: Lovely hospital
body: I recently had a hip replacement, I cannot thank all the staff enough from the surgeon and anaesthetist to the nursing and physio teams, everyone was kind, helpful and reassuring and an added bonus the food was great, I would definitely recommend Woodlands

title: Excellent Covid vaccination
body: All very well organised and felt very safe. Staff were efficient and caring. I have an aversion to needles and the surgery always accommodates my fears and works with me to overcome issues. The nurses are lovely and the Practice Manager is very caring and goes way beyond her job description to help me. I was also very grateful to the volunteers for braving the weather and donating their time.

title: COVID jab
body: Visited Buckshaw surgery this morning for my Covid jab, really well set out from start to finish, volunteers and staff keeping everyone calm and smiling while maintaining a professional practice. All working tirelessly under immense pressure, thank you to all involved!!

title: Absolutely incredible!!
body: I have never experienced the level of organization that I did today. I was back in my car all done by 2 mins after my appointment time. My mind is blown! Every staff member along the way was professional, clear and kind. What a fantastic team you have. Thank you for all you’ve done.

title: Coronavirus jab
body: Really well run service for the coronavirus service this morning!  I was sent to promptly, the staff were all very friendly and I was processed quickly.

title: Covid vaccinations
body:
to this practice and everywhere preparing for and delivering the vaccination programme. A huge thank you. Phenomenal effort. 

Just had my second jab.  Really efficient text booking service.  Lovely people doing the vaccinations.  Thank you all

title: Great Covid Service
body: Had my first dose today 1st May. It was very efficient and the nurses were very polite and helpful. Everyone is doing a great job.

title: Helpful practice LP
body: My husband recently came for blood test and found staff very accommodating in view of present circumstances. Our vaccination centre was extremely efficiently run.

title: Coronations vaccination/s
body: Both of my vaccinations took place at Melton Sports Village Leicestershire. Both were well organised, efficient in all aspects and very reassuring. Overall a credit to all volunteers,  medical staff and the NHS in delivering a first class service. We are very fortunate in the UK to have such a health service second to none other.

title: Superb staff and Doctors
body:
I have found the reception staff at the hickey surgery to be outstanding they have a full comprehension and perspective of the homeless and how to communicate, also the Doctors are both professional and Friendly they really give a feel to the homeless of both confidence and even security,
a very big thankyou to staff of the hickey surgery

title: Shockingly Unhelpful Receptionist
body: The problems start with trying to actually get through to the surgery with long waiting times on hold or constantly engaged. Once through you are subjected to the rude receptionist staff. One particular person does not listen and you have to repeat yourself several times over and over as they say its a bad line the other receptionist has no problem. This person has an bad attitude and when you need ungent help they show no compassion and offer very little assistance. In my opinion this surgery is taking on too many patients and not able to cope.  Some very nice doctors.

title: Went smoothly :)
body:
After reading the other reviews it was with some nervousness that I called up to make an appointment.
The pre-recorded message was only about 20s long, and even though I did press the wrong number I was transferred to the correct one with no need to redial.
The call was answered after 2 or 3 rings and the staff were super polite and I booked an appointment with no hassle at all.
I think that "treat others as you wish to be treated" goes a long way.

My asks: I'd like to be able to do more through the app - such as book an appt with the nurse. It's also probably worth quickly covering the options twice in the pre-recorded message.

title: Covid vaccination
body: I had my covid vaccination today at Buckshaw Village Surgery and it was extremely well organised. Despite being busy, everything ran like clockwork and I had my vaccination at the allotted time. Staff were friendly and efficient and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the venue to family and friends.

title: Excellent service
body: Seen on time, all precautions re co-virus were taken - was impressed and felt safe!  Saw the doctor, very impressed how easy it was to talk to her.  Felt as though I was listened to and understood.  My problem was solved.  Can only highly recommend the surgery and this includes the physiotherapy dept. and all doctors and receptionists (as a first call of contact - excellent) I have spoken to previously.  Thank you all very much!!!

author: hawkty38
title: OT and Physio
body: I was triaged and then seen by an OT and Physio who both addressed my needs extremely efficiently. I was treated with care and respect and the outcome has been really beneficial to my wellbeing! I am so grateful for the help I received from the NRC, especially Nicolette, Sharmin and Freya. Thank you so much!

author: sboyl
title: Retinal detachment
body: Had a full retinal detachment and tear. Dr cox and and his wonderful team did my surgery..I just want to say a big thank you also to the theatre staff and the fantastic staff of ward 1C. My anxiety levels were so high I just want to say you are all a credit to the nhs. I just want to say you are doing a fantastic job during this especially difficult time of covid. I work in the southern general,   and just want to say we are so lucky to have a wonderful nhs.

author: morag11
title: Stopping smoking & saving money
body: Gill my contact had been amazing I have stopped smoking now I’ve been on champix tablets they are the biz 11 days later I could not smoke a cigarette I tried but had to put it out it was disgusting it’s as they say will power has a lot to do with it but really you cannot smoke when you’re on these tablets side   affects very little also a little bit of homework to do which does help but Gill is amazing I’m saving soooo much money 30 cigs a day £15 over £100 a week so I now treat myself to whatever I want it’s great also my cough has gone and I feel soo much healthier now if you can brave it do it health cash nobody looking at you with disgust because you’re a smoker go for it 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

author: Padcam
title: Receiving the first vaccine.
body: Got the first vaccine- feel all good.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: TheoPapa
title: Vaccination service
body:
Top service in this covid vaccine site. Friendly informative staff and really kind, caring doctors.
We love the NHS. Please raise more taxes to fund it properly!

author: Laeril
title: Arm implant
body: I was really really nervous beforehand, as I've never had it before, or any kind of anaesthetic, but the staff were lovely and put me at ease. It felt strange at first but once the numbing kicked in it was fine. Information was clear and thorough.

author: apriljz73
title: Uncontrollable Anxiety
body:
Had a traumatic time in my life which triggered the anxiety so severely.
I can't fault the treatment I've received from the service and from my therapist.
The whole process was amazing and with everything I've learnt from therapy, I'm ready to start enjoying my life again.
Thank you so much!

author: giraffems33
title: Implant removal
body: Very efficient on arrival and booking in. Both nurses were very friendly and put me completely at ease

author: Sunny2021
title: Seeing the sexual health nurse during my pregnancy
body:
I’m 39 years old, at week 10 of my first pregnancy and I have a slight flare up of herpes; an infection I’ve had for 22 years. My midwife advised me to seek advice at the GUM clinic in the case of a breakout, and the Stafford clinic accommodated me on the very same day. The nurse, Suzie, was absolutely phenomenal from the start of the appointment to the very end. She is a kind, diligent, caring and compassionate lady and I’m extremely grateful for her thorough approach to advising and treating me, and also for her personable and genuine manner.  
She took time to reassure me and explain everything from a medical perspective, as well as imparting knowledge from her many years experience. Suzie really goes the extra mile to ensure her patient feels reassured, up to date and kept in the loop moving forward. She was very kind and really put me at ease during the examination, as did her colleague. Throughout my pregnancy, the care I received from Suzie has been by far the most thorough and diligent, and I have come away feeling very happy and satisfied with the experience. I made a point to say thank you to Suzie and compliment her on how good she is at her job. She is an asset to the GUM clinic and I really appreciate her care. Thank you again Suzie!

title: COVID Vax
body: Thanks for superb service regarding COVID Vax. at the Cathedral. Great system and very professional staffing. The practise is a pleasure to be signed up to and thanks for your help advice and service during the pandemic

title: Excellent practice
body: I recently joined the practice a few weeks ago and have already been very impressed. I was able to complete the paperwork to move practices on the day I visited the surgery, received documentation through the post the following day and the third day brought a telephone consultation with the doctor (all that was required). Email queries were responded to very quickly and all staff, whether the doctor, nursing, Reception or Dispensary have been very helpful and efficient - all during a pandemic. Well done and thank you.

title: Excellent practice and service
body: Cannot fault this practice, whenever we have needed this service they have never failed us. We would certainly recommend them.

title: What has Happened?
body: You just can’t get an appointment to spk or see a Dr, the phone lines are constantly engaged then when you do get through.... if your lucky all appointments are emergency only or you have to call back the next day! And it starts all over again..... It’s just so sad that this has happened to what was once a great practice.

title: Excellent
body: I had cataract operations at  SpaMedica Birmingham. All staff were helpful, efficient, professional and kind. I am very grateful to them all.

title: Covid vaccine
body: I attended to have my jab and was greeted by friendly volunteers. Once inside, the courteous and efficient staff soon had my vaccine administered and I was on my way.

title: Telephone problems
body:
Three times in the last couple of weeks I have tried to book a blood test on 8644 4343. First time I had to gave up after holding for 40 mins and only reached 3rd in the queue. Next time I waited 35 mins and reached the top of the queue , the phone then rang for another 5 mins and then cut out! Third attempt I waited 45mins to reach top of queue, and exactly the same happened. Why?

Michael Young

title: Getting nowhere
body: Tried phoning but after 90 times gave up. Been in 3 separate occasions over 4 week period  and got put on Covid 19 query list for Manager to review but as I said what’s the point it’s the same query that no one is dealing with. Eventually saw Manager who says she’d look at. Daughter then had no caller ID phone call following week which she didn’t answer for to her condition. Then got sent a text message to provide evidence of said condition. I am down as main point of contact as her carer so should have phoned me and I had told them to call me. Full consent on file. Took evidence in a week ago and copied to ve reviewed and here we are over a week later and still nothing changed! I will have to go in on Monday after work now to see what’s going on! And until this is sorted we can’t book her vaccine as her records aren’t accurate and she qualifies under the set criteria. Such a debacle!

title: Covid jab
body:
Professional, helpful and friendly! 
Very impressed as to how easy it was !
Well done all involved !

title: No beds in Children's ward
body: My Son broke his arm on Thursday, surgeon unable carry out the operation because there are no beds available in the Childrens ward. It is now Saturday my Son is in pain and we are waiting by the phone at home for news on a bed.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Experience
body: Had an amazing, efficient experience at the covid vaccine centre. Would recommend this centre. Staff very professional and efficient.

title: Buckshaw vaccination centre
body:
I’ve been this morning for my COVID vaccination. I was greeted by the car park attendant who promptly found me a suitable parking place. On approaching the surgery I was asked my time slot. I went in to register straight away. I was given some simple instructions & advised where to wait socially distanced. After a short wait it was my turn. Both nurses were lovely, asked me a few questions & I had my vaccination. Everything I needed to know was explained clearly. 
I left following a one way system back out to the car park. A very well organised appointment system. Well done Buckshaw surgery!

title: Efficient and friendly
body: COVID vaccination appointment - was very efficient and was there no more than 5-10 minutes. Nurses administering the jab very friendly.

title: Covid-19 vaccine
body: I had my 2nd jab on Friday 23rd April.  I found everything very well organised and everyone was very friendly.  I had bad headaches and felt groggy for a couple of days the same as I did after my first jab, but apart from that I have felt fine.  Well done everyone!

title: Poor communication
body: I have tried, since an urgent colonoscopy on March 5th, to get a histology test result on a polyp that was removed. It is now May 1st. I have even tried the Whittington , who tell me to contact my GP who referred me. Your receptionists have been ill informed & unhelpful. They lack sympathy. On two occasions when I have phoned, I was told to wait another three weeks, making six weeks in total!  I was told it would take one week, and the referring doctor asked me to get in touch if I did not get a result. On trying yet again this week to find out the result,  I asked the receptionist for help. I suggested she ask the referring doctor . Unbelievably, she told me that it was not their job to chase results!  Where is your duty of care?  I absolutely appreciate that you have Covid to deal with, but this is pretty basic help I have requested. I have been advised by medics I know socially, to instigate an official complaint. I am hoping this will be dealt with first. Your practice is the least friendly, coldest one I have known in a long life where I have known the care of good GP 's in & out of London.

title: Terrible
body: The reception staff are the most obnoxious, demeaning and unhelpful people i have ever dealt with, within the NHS. It's got to the point now that i don't even bother trying to contact the surgery any more as the stress caused by the attitude of the receptionists is not worth it

title: Great Practice and Great Care
body: I was admitted to Ward 11 for a hysteroscopy and polypectomy in April. I was really scared as I had never had an operation before. I had opted for a general anaesthetic. Without exception, all of the staff were fantastic. They were professional, caring, kind and thoughtful. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The staff, on the ward itself, could not do enough for patients. The ward was clean and well prepared with everything I needed. The theatre staff were great and continued to put me at ease until the moment the anaesthetic took effect. Back on the ward, the caring continued and I was walked to the loo for safety reasons. I was provided with a sandwich, crisps and a hot drink. I was given the information I needed for home and was duly discharged. I was then walked to my car by one of the members of staff. A huge thank you to each and everyone that was involved in my care.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Awful experiences
body:
Almost impossible to even get through to a receptionist, and when I have done, I Just hope I’m greeted by someone with respect, kindness plus compassion.   These three traits are missing by some of your staff and instead I’ve been spoken to like I’m a piece of dirt!  One such phone call left me in tears and feeling like a waste of space, due to the receptionist talking to me in an abhorrent manner. I have complained, and received a bog standard reply from the Practice Manager blaming Covid for her staff’s rude attitude!   
When you actually go into the surgery, again it’s pot luck if you’re to be met by a smiling and caring receptionist, or a grumpy pus rude one!
Like I said at the beginning almost impossible to get your call answered let alone an appointment.  This needs to be addressed, as not everyone can get to the surgery to que up For one.

title: Friendly and helpful
body: I needed to attend the surgery for a routine check, the reception staff booked me in quickly , easily and in a friendly manor. The nurse who I had for my appointment was so lovely and made me instantly at ease, thank you.

title: Very organised and friendly
body: So well organised. Volunteers and staff where amazing. Quick, confidence instilling and makes me so proud of our NHS. Thank you!

title: Good Practice
body: Seen on time. Dr was very througher. Gave me advise on the two problems I have. One is a lot better other stil troublesome.

title: Covid Jab 2
body: Just had my second Covid vaccination at the Fryatt. Thanks to everyone on the team (1May 12.20) .. kind, efficient and amazing! Thanks to everyone at the Fryatt fir everything you do!

title: Great vaccination service
body: First vaccination 3rd Feb, second 20th April both at Melton Sports Village. Excellently organised, friendly helpful staff. Great example of how to run a mass vaccination scheme. Text messages and booking were very efficient. The only worry was we did not know the second jab date in advance, that is not until the text 3 days before.

title: Great people great service
body: Had my first COVID vaccination here today. So well organised and great people. Would recommend this surgery to anyone

title: Absolutely shocking
body:
This Doctors has really gone down hill over the last few years . You cannot get through on the telephone , the reception staff are rude and miserable . It is not very welcoming when you do visit you are greeted with rude and abrupt staff and the nurses are just the same . Time to change surgeries for me and my family 
This used to be the best in town now it’s the worst

title: Caring surgery
body: Have to visit many times.during.the year and have always been treated with respect and kindness dealing with problems that may concern.me

title: Great practice
body: Everything was so well organized and even if a long queue outside for the vaccineI didn’t realize of waiting time

title: Very happy with my care
body: Visited Physician Associate for 8 week post-natal check for myself and new baby. Thorough review and addressed all of my concerns including prompt referral to secondary care when needed. I’ve been registered at this practice for 2 years and very happy with my care at all GP visits.

title: Fantastic vaccination centre
body:
I'm really impressed with the drive-thru vaccination centre they have set up. They seem to be getting through masses of people really quickly.

We went twice today, one for me then one for my wife a couple of hours later. Fast efficient, but the main thing was how friendly and happy the staff were. They are working hard and doing the same thing over and over again, but are there welcoming everyone, putting them at ease.

I even got a text for my follow up appointment right at the moment of getting the first injection in my arm.

I'm really impressed.

title: Disappointed
body: Our parent has spent time here, suggested improvements would be to call the person by their name in dealings with the family, not call the person a Service User, this became very upsetting as to us this is our loved one.

title: Brilliant Practice
body: I have been a patient for over 10 years of Clayhall Clinic. I have never been disappointed with service that I have received. There are always there when I have needed them and furthermore, very proactive in care

title: Wonderfully organised
body: I just visited Buckshaw Village Health Centre for my coronavirus jab, the whole experience was wonderfully organised, quick, efficient and very professional. The staff couldn’t have been more helpful or better trained to carry out the vaccinations. Well done our heroes, I feel very lucky to be so well looked after, thank you so much.

title: Outstanding information, operation and support
body: I was required to undergo many Royal Stoke reviews, academic tests and a functional MRI to confirm a recent brain tumour which had been identified, by another Hospital. The Royal Stoke neurosurgeon and the rest of the team had believed everything that I would need before and after the operation to remove the cancer and to actually have it identified a few weeks afterwards. The need for a neurophysiological team for the prior support and during the actual operation was detailed and worked well. Therefore, the brain operation went exactly as expected. As a result, two weeks later, there was little to discuss with the neurosurgeon that was not done or understood by me. The transfer to conduct Chemotherapy and Radiation treatment will be done at a nearer Hospital and the best opportunities were made by Royal Stoke and are complete. For me everybody not only understood all the aspects that were required but did not allow any delayed aspect due to Covid restrictions. This provided the best method of dealing with my cancer in the shortest time effectively. That was an epically high quality of people and sources at Royal Stoke and was magic to see. Very many thanks to all members of staff that I had seen or been managed with.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust
